sourceMeaningMnemonic: <radical>Tsunami</radical>s get <radical>blame</radical>d because they <kanji>pickle</kanji> everything in their path. That means that everything smells of pickles after a tsunami.
meaningInfo: Imagine a tsunami crashing over the land, being blamed by everyone. In its path are piles and piles of pickles, as far as the eye can see!
readingMnemonic: Looking at all those <kanji>pickle</kanji>s, you bend down and pick up <reading>two</reading> (<ja>つ</ja>) of them. One in each hand. You look at the pickles in your hand and wonder whether to try one.
readingInfo: Picture the two pickles and imagine what kind of pickles they are.
